Class RosterManager

java.lang.Object
RosterManager
public class RosterManager extends Object
Used to scan all the text being inputted and return statements
Author:
Edward Lei, Andy Zhang

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Continuously scans lines until it is stopped processing.

    • processArgs

      public boolean processArgs(Roster roster, String currLine)
      Checks arguments that are being inputted and sees if they are valid
      Parameters:
      roster - used to call add student
      currLine - used to parse through what is being typed in
      Returns:
      true if the argument is a valid input, return false otherwise

    • addStudent

      public void addStudent(Roster roster, String fname, String lname, String dobArg, String sMajor, String credits)
      Adds student to the roster
      Parameters:
      roster - is adding the student
      fname - first name being added to student object
      lname - last name being added to student object
      dobArg - date of birth being added to student object
      sMajor - major that is being added to student object
      credits - credits being added to student object

    • removeStudent

      public void removeStudent(Roster roster, String fname, String lname, String dobArg)
      Removes student from the roster, if it exists, prints text statement otherwise.
      Parameters:
      roster - checking if student is in roster
      fname - first name in student object
      lname - last name in student object
      dobArg - date of birth in student object

    • changeMajor

      public void changeMajor(Roster roster, String fname, String lname, String dobArg, String sMajor)
      Goes through roster to find the student and change their major
      Parameters:
      roster - parses for student
      fname - first name of the searched student
      lname - last name of the searched student
      dobArg - date of birth of the searched student
      sMajor - major that is being changed

    • isRosterEmpty

      public boolean isRosterEmpty(Roster roster)
      Check if the roster is empty and prints a text statement if it is.
      Parameters:
      roster - used to check size of roster
      Returns:
      true if it is empty, false otherwise

    • isSchoolEmpty

      public boolean isSchoolEmpty(Roster roster, String school)
      Checks if a school in a roster does nto have any students.
      Parameters:
      roster - is being checked
      school - checking if it has anyone
      Returns:
      true if the school is empty, false otherwise

    • isSchoolValid

      public boolean isSchoolValid(String school)
      Checks if the school that is inputted is a valid school at Rutgers
      Parameters:
      school - the school string is being checked for validity
      Returns:
      true if the school is valid, false otherwise

    • print

      public void print(Roster roster)
      Prints the roster if the roster is not empty. Prints alphabetically from last name, first name, and then ordered by date of birth.
      Parameters:
      roster - is being printed

    • printByStanding

      public void printByStanding(Roster roster)
      Prints the roster by standing, listed by Freshman, Junior, Senior, Sophomore.
      Parameters:
      roster - is being sorted in the printByStanding method

    • printBySchoolMajor

      public void printBySchoolMajor(Roster roster)
      Calls the printBySchoolMajor to sort the roster array. Prints the roster in order of school and then major.
      Parameters:
      roster - is being printed

    • listSchool

      public void listSchool(Roster roster, String school)
      List every student in a school and print it.
      Parameters:
      roster - being parsed through to find students in school
      school - use school to find every student in school

    • creditValid

      private boolean creditValid(String credits)
      Checks if the credits inputted are valid.
      Parameters:
      credits - is the string being checked
      Returns:
      true if credits is an integer, and is non-negative, return false otherwise

    • tryParse

      private Integer tryParse(String text)
      Used to parse the credits from the creditValid method and return an integer if it is an integer
      Parameters:
      text - is being parsed for an integer
      Returns:
      an integer if text is an integer, return null otherwise

    • parseMajor

      private Major parseMajor(String sMajor)
      Checks if the major is a real major that is in the enum.
      Parameters:
      sMajor - is being checked for its validity
      Returns:
      the major, return null otherwise

    • checkDate

      private boolean checkDate(String date)
      Checks the date string if is a valid date that can be used for a student. If the student is under 16 or the date of birth is invalid.
      Parameters:
      date - the student is being checked for validity
      Returns:
      true if the date of birth is valid, false otherwise
